resources.string: Start with the fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Learn the syntax, basic tags, styles, and how to make simple interactive elements.
Choose a front-end framework like React, Angular, or Vue.js. Follow tutorials and build small projects to understand components, state management, and routing.
Dive deeper into your chosen front-end framework. Learn about advanced concepts such as hooks in React, services in Angular, or Vuex in Vue.js.
Pick a back-end language and framework, such as Node.js with Express.js. Learn how to set up a server, handle requests and responses, and connect to a database.
Understand the basics of databases. Learn SQL for relational databases and NoSQL for document-based databases. Practice CRUD operations.
Learn how to connect your front-end with your back-end. Understand RESTful APIs, make HTTP requests, and handle data in your front-end application.
Get comfortable with Git and GitHub. Learn basic commands, branching, merging, and how to collaborate with others on projects.
Apply your skills by building full-stack projects. Start with simple applications and gradually add complexity. Focus on end-to-end functionality.
Learn the basics of deploying applications and managing servers. Understand the concepts of CI/CD, containerization with Docker, and using cloud services like AWS or Azure.
Work on a final project that showcases everything you\'ve learned. Review your progress, identify areas for improvement, and plan your next steps in web development.
